Interface Azimuth

    • Method Detail

      • isCanonical

        static boolean isCanonical(double azimuth)
        Checks if azimuth is canonical
        Parameters:
        azimuth, - the angle in radians to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the angle is included between 0 and (excluding)2PI

      • canonicalize

        static double canonicalize(double azimuth)
        Canonicalizes the azimuth
        Parameters:
        azimuth, - the angle in radians to be canonicalized
        Returns:
        the angle canonicalized between 0 and (excluding) 2PI

      • toMath

        static double toMath(double azimuth)
        Changes the orientation of the azimuth
        Parameters:
        azimuth, - the angle in radians to be converted in mathematical orientation
        Returns:
        the converted azimuth in mathematical orientation, in radians
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the azimuth is not canonical

      • fromMath

        static double fromMath(double azimuth)
        Changes the orientation of the azimuth
        Parameters:
        azimuth, - the angle in mathematical orientation to be converted in reverse orientation
        Returns:
        the converted azimuth in reverse mathematical orientation, in radians
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the azimuth is not canonical

      • toOctantString

        static java.lang.String toOctantString(double azimuth,
                                       java.lang.String n,
                                       java.lang.String e,
                                       java.lang.String s,
                                       java.lang.String w)
        Constructs a String that indicates the direction of the azimuth
        Parameters:
        azimuth, - the angle
        n, - the String for the north direction
        e, - the String for the east direction
        s, - the String for the south direction
        w, - the String for the west direction
        Returns:
        a String that indicates the direction of the azimuth
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the azimuth is not canonical
